metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28019 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 has Improper Initialization that can lead to recursion-based stack consumption or other consequences. This occurs because use of certain getc functions is mishandled when a client uses BDAT instead of DATA.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-28019` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-base - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-config - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
eximon4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> trusty/xenial ESM not affected. vulnerability was introduced by: https://git.exim.org/exim.git/patch/7e3ce68e68ab9b8906a637d352993abf361554e2

criterions.comment: exim4 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.94-15ubuntu1.2').
